title: Bank of England Governor appointment set to be delayed until after general election
text:
The appointment of the new Bank of England Governor is almost certain to be delayed for over a month due to the looming general election, sources have said.

An announcement on Mark Carney's replacement had been expected imminently. But the December 12 poll means Parliament must be dissolved by next Wednesday – and some reports suggest the Government could wrap up its business as soon as tomorrow night.

That would trigger the purdah period, which by convention prevents significant announcements during an election. The rule is only breached in exceptional circumstances, most recently in 2010 when then-Chancellor Alistair Darling joined an international bailout of Greece during the aftermath of...
